> If I decide I want functionality from the extracted class
> accessible f=
rom another package, it's usually a sign that
> I've got a new abstraction =
that's probably worth making
> public. At that point, I'll extract the func=
tionality out
> appropriately. 

I find that something similar is true for =
complex methods. If I find a
complex method, that's most often a sign that =
there is missing an
abstraction which's introduction would make the code bo=
th simpler and easier
to test.
